Package chessgame

Class ChessController

java.lang.Object
chessgame.ChessController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class ChessController extends Object implements Observer
The ChessController class; Implements the Observer class. This class is part of the MVC design pattern, and it acts as a controller in the MVC relationship. This controller acts as the communicator between the ChessGameContainer, ChessGame, and ChessView. When constructing a ChessController object, it requires reference to the model and view, to be able to call them directly through itself.

Additionally, this class is part of the Observer design pattern, and it acts as an Observer. When given reference to the model and view, it appends itself as an Observer to each of them, and handles any Event notified by the latter.

See Also:
  • Observer
  • ChessGameContainer
  • ChessGame
  • ChessView
  • Event

  • Constructor Details

    • ChessController

      public ChessController(ChessGame chessModel, ChessView chessView)
      Constructs a new ChessController object that acts as a controller and observer, and register itself with a ChessGame object that acts as the model, and a ChessView object that acts as the view.

      This constructor will also add the constructed controller as an Observer object to the registered model and view.

      Parameters:
      chessModel - the ChessGame object that acts as the model
      chessView - the ChessView object that acts as the view
      See Also:
      • ChessGame
      • ChessView
      • Observer
      • Subject.addObserver(Observer)

    • displayCurrentPlayerTurn

      public void displayCurrentPlayerTurn()
      Calls the chess view's displayPlayerTurn method to display the current player turn. This method calls the chess model's getPlayerTurn method to retrieve the current player turn.
      See Also:
      • ChessView.displayPlayerTurn(int)

    • displayCurrentPlayerStatus

      public void displayCurrentPlayerStatus()
      Calls the chess view's displayPlayerStatus method to display the current player's hasPlayed status. This method calls the currentPlayerHasPlayed method to retrieve the current player's hasPlayed status.
      See Also:
      • ChessView.displayPlayerTurn(int)
      • currentPlayerHasPlayed()

    • currentPlayerHasPlayed

      public boolean currentPlayerHasPlayed()
      Returns the current player's hasPlayed status. This method calls the chess model's getPlayerTurn method to retrieve the current player turn.
      Returns:
      true if the current player's hasPlayed == true
      See Also:
      • ChessGame.getPlayerTurn()
      • Player.hasPlayed()

    • switchTurnAndUpdateContainer

      public void switchTurnAndUpdateContainer()
      Calls the chess model to switch player turn and flip the board. Then calls the chess view to update the chess game container. This method also calls the chess model's switchPiecesIfPlayCountReached method to check piece switch condition.
      See Also:
      • ChessGame.switchTurnAndFlipBoard()
      • ChessGame.switchPiecesIfPlayCountReached()

    • convertCoordinateAndCheckPieceMove

      public boolean convertCoordinateAndCheckPieceMove(Point source, Point destination)
      Converts the source and destination Point of a chess piece from the container screen to board-relative and use them to check the piece's move. This method calls the chess model's checkPieceMove method.
      Parameters:
      source - the source Point
      destination - the destination Point
      Returns:
      true if the piece move is playable
      See Also:
      • ChessGame.checkPieceMove(Point, Point)

    • convertCoordinateAndCheckPiecePlayability

      public boolean convertCoordinateAndCheckPiecePlayability(Point piecePoint)
      Converts the Point of a chess piece from the container screen to board-relative and use its x, y coordinate to check the piece's playability. This method calls the chess model's checkPiecePlayability method.
      Parameters:
      piecePoint - the Point of a chess piece (java.awt.Point)
      Returns:
      true if the piece is playable
      See Also:
      • ChessGame.checkPiecePlayability(int, int)

    • convertCoordinateAndAttemptPlay

      public void convertCoordinateAndAttemptPlay(Point source, Point destination)
      Converts the source and destination Point of a chess piece from the container screen to board-relative and use them to attempt the piece move. This method calls the chess model's playPieceMove method.
      Parameters:
      source - the source Point
      destination - the destination Point
      See Also:
      • ChessGame.playPieceMove(Point, Point)

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      Starts a new chess game. This method sets the chess model with a new ChessGame object, and add itself as an Observer object to the chess model. It then calls the chess view to update the chess game container.
      See Also:
      • ChessGame
      • Subject.addObserver(Observer)

    • saveGameData

      public void saveGameData(File file)
      Calls the chess model's writeGameDataToFile method to save the game and notifies the save result to chess view to display.
      Parameters:
      file - the File object to save game data to
      See Also:
      • ChessGame.writeGameDataToFile(File)
      • ChessView.displaySaveResult(boolean)

      Returns:
      true if the game loaded successfully

    • handlePieceSwitchEvent

      public void handlePieceSwitchEvent()
      Handles the notified Event.PIECESWITCH. This method calls the chess view to notify the piece switch event and update the piece icons.
      See Also:

      • ChessView.notifyPieceSwitch()

    • handlePieceMoveEvent

      public void handlePieceMoveEvent()
      Handles the notified Event.PIECEMOVE. This method calls the chess view to update the chess game container.
      See Also:
      • handleEvent(Event)
      • Event.PIECEMOVE

    • handlePlayerWinEvent

      public void handlePlayerWinEvent(int winnerIndex)
      Handles the notified Event.PLAYERWIN. This method calls the chess view to prompt player for a new game.
      Parameters:
      winnerIndex - the index of the winner Player
      See Also:
      • handleEvent(Event)
      • ChessView.promptNewGameConfirmation(int)
